meanings.definition: To inform on someone to the authorities.
meanings.sent1: Tommy grassed on his friend for stealing the cookies.
meanings.sent2: She grassed to the teacher about the cheating incident.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel grassed on the other animals for hiding nuts.
meanings.sent4: The little bird grassed on its siblings for eating all the worms.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog never grassed on its owner, even when tempted with treats.

meanings.sent1: The field was grassed with fresh green blades.
meanings.sent2: The gardener grassed the lawn to make it look neat.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to grass their treehouse floor for a natural feel.
meanings.sent4: The soccer field was grassed beautifully for the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The park was grassed with soft, lush carpet-like grass for picnics.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the abandoned garden grassed over with wild plants.
meanings.sent2: The old path grassed over, blending into the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The playground slowly grassed over during the summer break.
meanings.sent4: The ruins of the castle grassed over, hiding its ancient stones.
meanings.sent5: The backyard grassed over, creating a natural green carpet.
